description: Variation of condition 3 of planning permission dated 21/11/2022 ref 2022/3641 (Use of pavement to front elevation as an outside seating area in association with restaurant (Class E).) so as to allow the use of the pavement on a permanent extended hours of 0800 to 2300 daily.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of the original permission (16.10.2022).
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [Location Plan (dated 14/07/2022); Proposed External GA Plan (ref. 224/01); Fire Safety Statement (dated
28/09/2022)]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - The use of the pavement fronting Bedford Hill for outdoor seating (8 x tables and 16 x chairs) shall only take place between the hours of 08:00 and 23:00. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council LP2 of the Wandsworth Local Plan  
Condition : 4 - When not in use the tables and chairs shall be removed from the pavement frontage area.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2
Condition : 5 - No amplified sound or speech shall be generated by the use hereby approved so as to be audible within the adjacent residential premises. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2
Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE: Notwithstanding the above planning permission, as the proposed tables and chairs would be
located on the public highway the applicant needs to apply to the council for a highways licence.
Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
